sen.j: 藤原 吉野（ふじわら の よしの、延暦5年（786年） - 承和_(日本)13年8月12日 (旧暦)（846年9月10日））は平安時代初期の貴族。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoshino (786 - September 10, 846 (lunar calendar)) was a court noble who lived in the early Heian period,
FUJIWARA no Yoshino (786 - September 10, 846 (lunar calendar)) was a court noble who lived in the early Heian period,
FUJIWARA no Yoshino (786 - September 10, 846) was a court noble who lived in the early Heian period,
sen.cmt: 新暦のみ記載しました。 (lunar calendar)削除。

sen.j: 藤原式家藤原綱継の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the first son of FUJIWARA no Tsunatsugu of FUJIWARA-no-Shikke.
He was born as the first son of FUJIWARA no Tsunatsugu of FUJIWARA-no-Shikke.
He was born as the first son of FUJIWARA no Tsunatsugu of Fujiwara Shikike (a sub branch of Fujiwara family).
sen.cmt: 藤原式家→Fujiwara Shikike (a sub branch of Fujiwara family)

sen.j: 母は綱継の異母妹という。
sen.e: It is said that his mother was the younger sister of Tsunatsugu of the different mother.
It is said that his mother was the younger sister of Tsunatsugu of a different mother.
It is said that his mother was the younger sister of Tsunatsugu of a different mother.

sen.j: 式家出身の母を持つ淳和天皇とは同年齢で親しく（天皇の乳兄弟とする説もある）、その生涯を天皇の為に捧げる事になる。
sen.e: He had close relation with the Emperor Junna, who had a mother from the Shikke and was at the same age as Yoshino (Some say that he was a foster brother to the Emperor Junna.), and he devoted his life to the Emperor.

He had close relations with the Emperor Junna, who had a mother from the Shikke and was the same age as Yoshino (Some say that he was a foster brother to the Emperor Junna.), and devoted his life to the Emperor.

He had close relations with the Emperor Junna, who had a mother from Fujiwara Shikike and was the same age as Yoshino (Some say that he was a foster brother to the Emperor Junna.), and devoted his life to the Emperor.

sen.j: 駿河国守として実績をあげて頭角を現す。
sen.e: He distinguished himself by bringing satisfactory results as Suruga no kuni no kami (the governor of Suruga Province).
He distinguished himself by bringing satisfactory results as Suruga no kuni no kami (the governor of Suruga Province).
He distinguished himself by bringing satisfactory results as Suruga no kuni no kami (the governor of Suruga Province).

sen.j: 淳和天皇の即位後は都に呼び戻されて側近として活躍し、天長3年（825年）に蔵人頭となって天皇の政策を助けた。
sen.e: After enthronement of the Emperor Junna, he was called back to the capital and worked actively as a close aide to the Emperor Junna and, in 825, he was appointed to the kurodo no to (chief official of the emperor's secretaries) and helped the Emperor Junna in executing his policies.

After enthronement of the Emperor Junna, he was called back to the capital and worked actively as a close aide to the Emperor Junna and, in 825, he was appointed to the kurodo no to (chief official of the emperor's secretaries) and helped the Emperor Junna in executing his policies.

After enthronement of the Emperor Junna, he was called back to the capital and worked actively as a close aide to the Emperor Junna and, in 825, he was appointed to the kurodo no to (chief official of the emperor's secretaries) and helped the Emperor Junna in executing his policies.

sen.j: わずか2年後には参議に抜擢され、その4年後には中納言・右近衛大将・春宮大夫を兼任するに至る。
sen.e: After only two years, he was selected to a sangi (royal advisor), and, four years thereafter, he worked as chunagon (middle counselor), ukonoe taisho (major captain of the Right Division of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guard) and togu no daibu (a master of the Crown Prince's palace), concurrently.

After only two years, he was selected to a sangi (royal advisor), and, four years thereafter, he worked as chunagon (middle counselor), ukonoe taisho (major captain of the Right Division of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guard) and togu no daibu (a master of the Crown Prince's palace), concurrently.

After only two years, he was selected to a sangi (royal advisor), and, four years thereafter, he worked as chunagon (middle counselor), ukonoe taisho (major captain of the Right Division of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guard) and togu no daibu (a master of the Crown Prince's palace), concurrently.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 天皇が仁明天皇に皇位を譲ると、正三位中納言になるが、専ら淳和上皇の傍につき従った。
sen.e: When the Emperor Junna abdicated the throne in favor of the Emperor Ninmyo, Yoshino was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) chunagon, but he devotedly followed the Retired Emperor Junna.
When the Emperor Junna abdicated the throne in favor of the Emperor Ninmyo, Yoshino was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) chunagon, but he devotedly followed the Retired Emperor Junna.
When the Emperor Junna abdicated the throne in favor of the Emperor Ninmyo, Yoshino was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) chunagon, but he devotedly followed the Retired Emperor Junna.

sen.j: 承和7年（840年）に淳和上皇が危篤となり、兄の嵯峨天皇や仁明天皇に遠慮して「自分の遺骨を散骨して、この世に野心を残していないことを示して欲しい」と遺言すると、吉野は必死に押し留めようとしたが、間もなく上皇が崩御すると、吉野は泣く泣くその指示を実行したという。
sen.e: Reportedly, when the Retired Emperor fell into critical condition in 840 and expressed his dying wish out of consideration for feeling of his elder brother, the Emperor Saga and the Emperor Ninmyo "Please scatter my ashes to show that I leave no ambition in this world", Yoshino desperately tried to stop him but, after the Retired Emperor Junna died before long, he tearfully executed the instruction.

Reportedly, when the Retired Emperor fell into critical condition in 840 and expressed his dying wish out of consideration for feeling of his elder brother, the Emperor Saga and the Emperor Ninmyo "Please scatter my ashes to show that I leave no ambition in this world", Yoshino desperately tried to stop him but, after the Retired Emperor Junna died before long, he tearfully executed the instruction.

Reportedly, when the Retired Emperor Junna fell into critical condition in 840 and expressed his dying wish out of consideration for feeling of his elder brother, the Emperor Saga and the Emperor Ninmyo 'Please scatter my ashes to show that I leave no ambition in this world,' Yoshino desperately tried to stop him but, after the Retired Emperor died before long, he tearfully executed the instruction.
sen.cmt: Junna補足しました。後ろのJunnaは削除しました。原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: この時点で、政治の第一線から退き、上皇の息子である皇太子恒貞親王の為に尽くすことを考えるが、仁明天皇の慰留を受けて中納言の地位に留まっている。
sen.e: At this point of time, he considered to retire from active stage of politics and serve the Crown Prince Tsunesada, who was the son of the Retired Emperor, but, being persuaded by the Emperor Ninmyo, he stayed in the position of the chunagon.

At this point of time, he considered to retire from active stage of politics and serve the Crown Prince Tsunesada, who was the son of the Retired Emperor, but, being persuaded by the Emperor Ninmyo, he stayed in the position of the chunagon.

At this point of time, he considered to retire from active stage of politics and serve the Crown Prince Tsunesada, who was the son of the Retired Emperor, but, being persuaded by the Emperor Ninmyo, he stayed in the position of the chunagon.

sen.j: だが、承和9年（842年）7月、突如恒貞親王や吉野らは謀反の疑いをかけられてしまう。
sen.e: In July 842, however, the Imperial Prince Tsunesada and Yoshino were suddenly suspected of treason.
In July 842, however, the Imperial Prince Tsunesada and Yoshino were suddenly suspected of treason.
In July 842, however, the Imperial Prince Tsunesada and Yoshino were suddenly suspected of treason.

sen.j: 親王は廃太子とされ、吉野は大宰権帥に左遷させられてしまう（「承和の変」）。
sen.e: The Imperial Prince Tsunesada was disinherited and Yoshino was demoted to the dazai no gon no sochi (acting governor-general of Government Headquarters in Kyushu) ("Showa Incident").
The Imperial Prince Tsunesada was disinherited and Yoshino was demoted to the dazai no gon no sochi (acting governor-general of Government Headquarters in Kyushu) ("Showa Incident").
The Imperial Prince Tsunesada was disinherited and Yoshino was demoted to the dazai no gon no sochi (acting governor-general of Government Headquarters in Kyushu) ('Jowa Incident').
sen.cmt: 承和の変→→Jowa Incidentに訂正しました。原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: さらに3年後には山城国内にて幽閉されて失意の内に病死した。
sen.e: Three years later, he was confined in Yamashiro no kuni (Yamashiro Province) and died of illness a disappointed person.
Three years later, he was confined in Yamashiro no kuni (Yamashiro Province) and died of illness a disappointed person.
Three years later, he was confined in Yamashiro no kuni (Yamashiro Province) and died of illness a disappointed person.

sen.j: 学問に優れて寛大で、淳和天皇だけでなく多くの人達から信頼されたという。
sen.e: He excelled in scholarship and he was generous and he was trusted by a large number of persons.
He excelled in scholarship and was generous and trusted by a large number of persons.
He excelled in scholarship and was generous and trusted by a large number of persons.

sen.j: 弘仁4年（813年）以前 - 主蔵正
sen.e: Before 813, kura no kami (officer in the togubo).
Before 813, kura no kami (officer in the togubo).
Before 813, Kura no kami (officer in the togubo).
sen.cmt: 主蔵正→Kura no kami (an officer in the togubo)

sen.j: 弘仁4年（813年） - 美濃少掾
sen.e: 813, the mino shojo (a junior secretary of Mino Province).
813, the mino shojo (a junior secretary of Mino Province).
813, the mino shojo (a junior secretary of Mino Province).

sen.j: 弘仁7年（816年） - （後の淳和天皇の）春宮少進
sen.e: 816, shungu-shoshin (an official of the Crown Prince's Palace)
816, shungu-shoshin (an official of the Crown Prince's Palace)
816, Togu shoshin (an official of the Crown Prince's (later, Emperor Junna's) Quarters)
sen.cmt: 春宮少進→Togu shoshin (an official of the Crown Prince's Quarters)Emperor Junna補足しました。

sen.j: 弘仁10年（819年） - 従五位下駿河守
sen.e: 819, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Suruga no kami (the governor of Suruga Province)
819, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Suruga no kami (the governor of Suruga Province)
819, Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Suruga no kami (the governor of Suruga Province)

sen.j: 弘仁14年(823年) - 中務少輔、次いで左近衛少将・伊予守
sen.e: 823, nakatsukasa shoyu (a junior assistant minister of the Ministry of Middle) and, then, sakonoe shosho (minor captain of the Left Division of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guard) and Iyo no kami (Governor of Iyo Province)

823, nakatsukasa shoyu (a junior assistant minister of the Ministry of Middle) and, then, sakonoe shosho (minor captain of the Left Division of the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guard) and Iyo no kami (Governor of Iyo Province)

823, Nakatsukasa no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs) and, then, Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Iyo no kami (the governor of Iyo Province)
sen.cmt: 中務少輔→Nakatsukasa no shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs)左近衛少将→Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards)the governerとしました。

sen.j: 天長元年（824年） - 従五位上左少弁
sen.e: 824, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and sashoben (minor controller of the left)
824, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and sashoben (minor controller of the left)
824, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and sashoben (minor controller of the left)

sen.j: 天長3年（826年） - 蔵人頭、同年正五位下
sen.e: 826, kurodo no to, and in the same year Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
826, kurodo no to, and in the same year Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
826, kurodo no to, and in the same year Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 天長4年（827年） - 従四位下、伊勢守・皇后宮大夫・右兵衛督を相次いで兼任
sen.e: 827, Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade); assumed Ise no kami (Governor of Ise Province), kogogu-daibu (the Lord Steward to Her Majesty the Empress) and the uhyoe no kami, concurrently
827, Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade); assumed Ise no kami (Governor of Ise Province), kogogu-daibu (the Lord Steward to Her Majesty the Empress) and the uhyoe no kami, concurrently

827, Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade); assumed Ise no kami (the governor of Ise Province), Kogogu daibu (Master of the Empress's Household) and Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), concurrently
sen.cmt: 皇后宮大夫→Kogogu daibu (Master of the Empress's Household)右兵衛督→Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards)the governerとしました。

sen.j: 天長5年（826年） - 参議
sen.e: 826, sangi
826, sangi
826, Sangi (councillor)

sen.j: 天長7年（828年） - 正四位下
sen.e: 828, Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)
828, Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)
828, Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 天長9年（832年） - 権中納言・春宮大夫・右近衛大将
sen.e: 832, gon-chunagon, togu no daibu and ukonoe taisho
832, gon-chunagon, togu no daibu and ukonoe taisho
832, gon-chunagon, togu no daibu and ukonoe taisho

sen.j: 天長10年（833年） - 正三位、淳和天皇退位とともに春宮大夫・右近衛大将辞任
sen.e: 833, Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank); on the occasion of the Emperor Junna's abdiction, resigned as the togu no daibu and ukonoe taisho
833, Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank); on the occasion of the Emperor Junna's abdiction, resigned as the togu no daibu and ukonoe taisho
833, Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank); on the occasion of the Emperor Junna's abdication, resigned as the togu no daibu and ukonoe taisho

sen.j: 承和元年（834年） - 中納言
sen.e: 834, chunagon
834, chunagon
834, chunagon

sen.j: 承和7年（840年） - 淳和上皇崩御
sen.e: 840, the Retired Emperor Junna died.
840, the Retired Emperor Junna died.
840, the Retired Emperor Junna died.

sen.j: 承和9年（842年） - 大宰員外帥に左遷（承和の変）
sen.e: 842, demoted to the dazai no gon no sochi ("Showa Incident").
842, demoted to the dazai no gon no sochi ("Showa Incident").
842, demoted to the dazai no gon no sochi (Jowa Incident).
sen.cmt: 承和の変→→Jowa Incidentに訂正しました。" "削除しました。

sen.j: 承和12年（845年） - 大宰員外帥も解任されて幽閉される
sen.e: 845, dismissed as the dazai no gon no sochi and confined.
845, dismissed as the dazai no gon no sochi and confined.
845, dismissed as the dazai no gon no sochi and confined.
846, died at the age of 61
